trans-unit.source: Move data to SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine| Azure
trans-unit.target: Move data to SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine| Azure

trans-unit.source: Move data from flat files or from an on-premises SQL Server to SQL Server on Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: Move data from flat files or from an on-premises SQL Server to SQL Server on Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: Move data to SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Move data to SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: **This document** outlines the options for moving data either from flat files (CSV or TSV formats) or from an on-premise SQL Server to SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: **This document** outlines the options for moving data either from flat files (CSV or TSV formats) or from an on-premise SQL Server to SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: These tasks for moving data to the cloud are part of the Cortana Analytics Process provided by Azure.
trans-unit.target: These tasks for moving data to the cloud are part of the Cortana Analytics Process provided by Azure.

trans-unit.source: For a topic that outlines the options for moving data to an Azure SQL Database for Machine Learning, see [Move data to an Azure SQL Database for Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-data-science-move-sql-azure.md).
trans-unit.target: For a topic that outlines the options for moving data to an Azure SQL Database for Machine Learning, see [Move data to an Azure SQL Database for Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-data-science-move-sql-azure.md).

trans-unit.source: The **menu** below links to topics that describe how to ingest data into other target environments where the data can be stored and processed during the Cortana Analytics Process (CAPS).
trans-unit.target: The **menu** below links to topics that describe how to ingest data into other target environments where the data can be stored and processed during the Cortana Analytics Process (CAPS).

trans-unit.source: The following table summarizes the options for moving data to SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The following table summarizes the options for moving data to SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Database backup and restore
trans-unit.target: Database backup and restore

trans-unit.source: Note that this document assumes that SQL commands are executed from SQL Server Management Studio or Visual Studio Database Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Note that this document assumes that SQL commands are executed from SQL Server Management Studio or Visual Studio Database Explorer.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] As an alternative, you can use [Azure Data Factory](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/data-factory/) to create and schedule a pipeline that will move data to a SQL Server VM on Azure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] As an alternative, you can use [Azure Data Factory](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/data-factory/) to create and schedule a pipeline that will move data to a SQL Server VM on Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Copy data with Azure Data Factory (Copy Activity)](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Copy data with Azure Data Factory (Copy Activity)](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have:

trans-unit.source: An **Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: An **Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have a subscription, you can sign up for a [free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you do not have a subscription, you can sign up for a [free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: An **Azure storage account**.
trans-unit.target: An **Azure storage account**.

trans-unit.source: You will use an Azure storage account for storing the data in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will use an Azure storage account for storing the data in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure storage account, see the [Create a storage account](storage-create-storage-account.md#create-a-storage-account) article.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure storage account, see the [Create a storage account](storage-create-storage-account.md#create-a-storage-account) article.

trans-unit.source: After you have created the storage account, you will need to obtain the account key used to access the storage.
trans-unit.target: After you have created the storage account, you will need to obtain the account key used to access the storage.

trans-unit.source: See [View, copy and regenerate storage access keys](storage-create-storage-account.md#view-copy-and-regenerate-storage-access-keys).
trans-unit.target: See [View, copy and regenerate storage access keys](storage-create-storage-account.md#view-copy-and-regenerate-storage-access-keys).

trans-unit.source: Provisioned **SQL Server on an Azure VM**.
trans-unit.target: Provisioned **SQL Server on an Azure VM**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Set up an Azure SQL Server virtual machine as an IPython Notebook server for advanced analytics](machine-learning-data-science-setup-sql-server-virtual-machine.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Set up an Azure SQL Server virtual machine as an IPython Notebook server for advanced analytics](machine-learning-data-science-setup-sql-server-virtual-machine.md).

trans-unit.source: Installed and configured **Azure PowerShell** locally.
trans-unit.target: Installed and configured **Azure PowerShell** locally.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](powershell-install-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](powershell-install-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Moving data from a flat file source to SQL Server on an Azure VM
trans-unit.target: Moving data from a flat file source to SQL Server on an Azure VM

trans-unit.source: If your data is in a flat file (arranged in a row/column format), it can be moved to SQL Server VM on Azure via the following methods:
trans-unit.target: If your data is in a flat file (arranged in a row/column format), it can be moved to SQL Server VM on Azure via the following methods:

trans-unit.source: [Command line bulk copy utility (BCP)](#insert-tables-bcp)
trans-unit.target: [Command line bulk copy utility (BCP)](#insert-tables-bcp)

trans-unit.source: [Bulk Insert SQL Query ](#insert-tables-bulkquery)
trans-unit.target: [Bulk Insert SQL Query ](#insert-tables-bulkquery)

trans-unit.source: [Graphical Built-in Utilities in SQL Server (Import/Export, SSIS)](#sql-builtin-utilities)
trans-unit.target: [Graphical Built-in Utilities in SQL Server (Import/Export, SSIS)](#sql-builtin-utilities)

trans-unit.source: Command line bulk copy utility (BCP)
trans-unit.target: Command line bulk copy utility (BCP)

trans-unit.source: BCP is a command line utility installed with SQL Server and is one of the quickest ways to move data.
trans-unit.target: BCP is a command line utility installed with SQL Server and is one of the quickest ways to move data.

trans-unit.source: It works across all three SQL Server variants (On-premises SQL Server, SQL Azure and SQL Server VM on Azure).
trans-unit.target: It works across all three SQL Server variants (On-premises SQL Server, SQL Azure and SQL Server VM on Azure).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] **Where should my data be for BCP?** While it is not required, having files containing source data located on the same machine as the target SQL server allows for faster transfers (network speed vs local disk IO speed).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] **Where should my data be for BCP?** While it is not required, having files containing source data located on the same machine as the target SQL server allows for faster transfers (network speed vs local disk IO speed).

trans-unit.source: You can move the flat files containing data to the machine where SQL Server is installed using various file copying tools such as [AZCopy](../storage-use-azcopy.md), [Azure Storage Explorer](https://azurestorageexplorer.codeplex.com/) or windows copy/paste via Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).
trans-unit.target: You can move the flat files containing data to the machine where SQL Server is installed using various file copying tools such as [AZCopy](../storage-use-azcopy.md), [Azure Storage Explorer](https://azurestorageexplorer.codeplex.com/) or windows copy/paste via Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the database and the tables are created on the target SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the database and the tables are created on the target SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of how to do that using the `Create Database` and `Create Table` commands:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of how to do that using the `Create Database` and `Create Table` commands:

trans-unit.source: Generate the format file that describes the schema for the table by issuing the following command from the command line of the machine where bcp is installed.
trans-unit.target: Generate the format file that describes the schema for the table by issuing the following command from the command line of the machine where bcp is installed.

trans-unit.source: Insert the data into the database using the bcp command as follows.
trans-unit.target: Insert the data into the database using the bcp command as follows.

trans-unit.source: This should work from the command line assuming that the SQL Server is installed on same machine:
trans-unit.target: This should work from the command line assuming that the SQL Server is installed on same machine:

trans-unit.source: **Optimizing BCP Inserts** Please refer the following article ['Guidelines for Optimizing Bulk Import'](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms177445%28v=sql.105%29.aspx) to optimize such inserts.
trans-unit.target: **Optimizing BCP Inserts** Please refer the following article ['Guidelines for Optimizing Bulk Import'](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms177445%28v=sql.105%29.aspx) to optimize such inserts.

trans-unit.source: Parallelizing Inserts for Faster Data Movement
trans-unit.target: Parallelizing Inserts for Faster Data Movement

trans-unit.source: If the data you are moving is large, you can speed things up by simultaneously executing multiple BCP commands in parallel in a PowerShell Script.
trans-unit.target: If the data you are moving is large, you can speed things up by simultaneously executing multiple BCP commands in parallel in a PowerShell Script.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] **Big data Ingestion** To optimize data loading for large and very large datasets, partition your logical and physical database tables using multiple filegroups and partition tables.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] **Big data Ingestion** To optimize data loading for large and very large datasets, partition your logical and physical database tables using multiple filegroups and partition tables.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating and loading data to partition tables, see [Parallel Load SQL Partition Tables](machine-learning-data-science-parallel-load-sql-partitioned-tables.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating and loading data to partition tables, see [Parallel Load SQL Partition Tables](machine-learning-data-science-parallel-load-sql-partitioned-tables.md).

trans-unit.source: The sample PowerShell script below demonstrate parallel inserts using bcp :
trans-unit.target: The sample PowerShell script below demonstrate parallel inserts using bcp :

trans-unit.source: Bulk Insert SQL Query
trans-unit.target: Bulk Insert SQL Query

trans-unit.source: [Bulk Insert SQL Query](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188365) can be used to import data into the database from row/column based files (the supported types are covered in the[Prepare Data for Bulk Export or Import (SQL Server)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188609)) topic.
trans-unit.target: [Bulk Insert SQL Query](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188365) can be used to import data into the database from row/column based files (the supported types are covered in the[Prepare Data for Bulk Export or Import (SQL Server)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188609)) topic.

trans-unit.source: Here are some sample commands for Bulk Insert are as below:
trans-unit.target: Here are some sample commands for Bulk Insert are as below:

trans-unit.source: Analyze your data and set any custom options before importing to make sure that the SQL Server database assumes the same format for any special fields such as dates.
trans-unit.target: Analyze your data and set any custom options before importing to make sure that the SQL Server database assumes the same format for any special fields such as dates.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of how to set the date format as year-month-day (if your data contains the date in year-month-day format):
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of how to set the date format as year-month-day (if your data contains the date in year-month-day format):

trans-unit.source: Built-in Utilities in SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Built-in Utilities in SQL Server

trans-unit.source: You can use SQL Server Integrations Services (SSIS) to import data into SQL Server VM on Azure from a flat file.
trans-unit.target: You can use SQL Server Integrations Services (SSIS) to import data into SQL Server VM on Azure from a flat file.

trans-unit.source: SSIS is available in two studio environments.
trans-unit.target: SSIS is available in two studio environments.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Integration Services (SSIS) and Studio Environments](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms140028.aspx):
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Integration Services (SSIS) and Studio Environments](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms140028.aspx):

trans-unit.source: For details on SQL Server Data Tools, see [Microsoft SQL Server Data Tools](https://msdn.microsoft.com/data/tools.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For details on SQL Server Data Tools, see [Microsoft SQL Server Data Tools](https://msdn.microsoft.com/data/tools.aspx)

trans-unit.source: For details on the Import/Export Wizard, see [SQL Server Import and Export Wizard](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms141209.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For details on the Import/Export Wizard, see [SQL Server Import and Export Wizard](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms141209.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Deploy a SQL Server Database to a Microsoft Azure VM wizard
trans-unit.target: Deploy a SQL Server Database to a Microsoft Azure VM wizard

trans-unit.source: The **Deploy a SQL Server Database to a Microsoft Azure VM wizard** is a simple and recommended way to move data from an on-premises SQL Server instance to SQL Server on an Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: The **Deploy a SQL Server Database to a Microsoft Azure VM wizard** is a simple and recommended way to move data from an on-premises SQL Server instance to SQL Server on an Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: For detailed steps as well as a discussion of other alternatives, see [Migrate a database to SQL Server on an Azure VM](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-migrate-onpremises-database.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed steps as well as a discussion of other alternatives, see [Migrate a database to SQL Server on an Azure VM](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-migrate-onpremises-database.md).

trans-unit.source: Export to Flat File
trans-unit.target: Export to Flat File

trans-unit.source: Various methods can be used to bulk export data from an On-Premises SQL Server as documented in the [Bulk Import and Export of Data (SQL Server)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms175937.aspx) topic.
trans-unit.target: Various methods can be used to bulk export data from an On-Premises SQL Server as documented in the [Bulk Import and Export of Data (SQL Server)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms175937.aspx) topic.

trans-unit.source: This document will cover the Bulk Copy Program (BCP) as an example.
trans-unit.target: This document will cover the Bulk Copy Program (BCP) as an example.

trans-unit.source: Once data is exported into a flat file, it can be imported to another SQL server using bulk import.
trans-unit.target: Once data is exported into a flat file, it can be imported to another SQL server using bulk import.

trans-unit.source: Export the data from on-premises SQL Server to a File using the bcp utility as follows
trans-unit.target: Export the data from on-premises SQL Server to a File using the bcp utility as follows

trans-unit.source: Create the database and the table on SQL Server VM on Azure using the `create database` and `create table` for the table schema exported in step 1.
trans-unit.target: Create the database and the table on SQL Server VM on Azure using the `create database` and `create table` for the table schema exported in step 1.

trans-unit.source: Create a format file for describing the table schema of the data being exported/imported.
trans-unit.target: Create a format file for describing the table schema of the data being exported/imported.

trans-unit.source: Details of the format file are described in [Create a Format File (SQL Server)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms191516.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Details of the format file are described in [Create a Format File (SQL Server)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms191516.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Format file generation when running BCP from the SQL Server machine
trans-unit.target: Format file generation when running BCP from the SQL Server machine

trans-unit.source: Format file generation when running BCP remotely against a SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Format file generation when running BCP remotely against a SQL Server

trans-unit.source: Use any of the methods described in section [Moving Data from File Source](#filesource_to_sqlonazurevm) to move the data in flat files to a SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Use any of the methods described in section [Moving Data from File Source](#filesource_to_sqlonazurevm) to move the data in flat files to a SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database Migration Wizard
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Migration Wizard

trans-unit.source: [SQL Server Database Migration Wizard](http://sqlazuremw.codeplex.com/) provides a user-friendly way to move data between two SQL server instances.
trans-unit.target: [SQL Server Database Migration Wizard](http://sqlazuremw.codeplex.com/) provides a user-friendly way to move data between two SQL server instances.

trans-unit.source: It allows the user to map the data schema between sources and destination tables, choose column types and various other functionality.
trans-unit.target: It allows the user to map the data schema between sources and destination tables, choose column types and various other functionality.

trans-unit.source: It uses bulk copy (BCP) under the covers.
trans-unit.target: It uses bulk copy (BCP) under the covers.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot of the welcome screen for the SQL Database Migration wizard is shown below.
trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the welcome screen for the SQL Database Migration wizard is shown below.

trans-unit.source: ![SQL Server Migration Wizard][2]
trans-unit.target: ![SQL Server Migration Wizard][2]

trans-unit.source: Database backup and restore
trans-unit.target: Database backup and restore

trans-unit.source: SQL Server supports:
trans-unit.target: SQL Server supports:

trans-unit.source: [Database backup and restore functionality](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms187048.aspx) (both to a local file or bacpac export to blob) and [Data Tier Applications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee210546.aspx) (using bacpac).
trans-unit.target: [Database backup and restore functionality](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms187048.aspx) (both to a local file or bacpac export to blob) and [Data Tier Applications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee210546.aspx) (using bacpac).

trans-unit.source: Ability to directly create SQL Server VMs on Azure with a copied database or copy to an existing SQL Azure database.
trans-unit.target: Ability to directly create SQL Server VMs on Azure with a copied database or copy to an existing SQL Azure database.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see [Use the Copy Database Wizard](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188664.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see [Use the Copy Database Wizard](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188664.aspx).

trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the Database backup/restore options from SQL Server Management Studio are shown below.
